docs.snippet: Amid identity politics and the partisan divide, faculty members struggle to manage testy exchanges and potential attacks, sometimes on them.

headline.main: In a Volatile Climate on Campus, Professors Teach on Tenterhooks

docs.snippet: Wednesday: The basics of buying flood insurance, the 35th anniversary of “E.T.,” and the rainiest day on record.

docs.snippet: From “Saturday Night Live” to “The Handmaid’s Tale,” shows with a political — and anti-Trump — viewpoint ruled the day at the Emmy Awards.

docs.snippet: What happens when a nation’s boundaries and its national identity contradict? In extreme cases, something like Myanmar’s Rohingya crisis.

headline.print_headline: Myanmar Follows Global Pattern in How Ethnic Cleansing Begins

docs.snippet: The West made a saint of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi. The Rohingya crisis revealed a politician.

headline.print_headline: This Is Not a Morality Tale

docs.snippet: President Trump discussed a range of issues with The New York Times, including the Russia inquiry, the tax overhaul and China, at his golf club in West Palm Beach, Fla.

docs.snippet: The Caribbean islands scrambled to prepare for another big storm, Hurricane Maria, which was barreling through only days after Irma killed more than two dozen.

headline.main: Hurricane Maria Makes Landfall in Dominica as Other Islands Brace for Potential Disaster

docs.snippet: Startled by the hard sell addicts face, a psychologist discovered the rehab industry’s customer acquisition tricks, one crank call at a time.

docs.snippet: The chef’s huge effort is just the latest led by cooks, who are showing a more agile, locally based way to feed people after a disaster.
